head.title: Metro Briefing | New York: Brooklyn: Two Killed In Crashes

hedline.hl1: Metro Briefing | New York: Brooklyn: Two Killed In Crashes

body.head.byline: By THOMAS J. LUECK; Compiled by John Sullivan

block.p: Two men died and a third man was seriously injured in two motor vehicle accidents Saturday night and early yesterday, the police said. A 58-year-old man was killed when he drove a Mercedes-Benz through a fence and into a parked car at 3:45 a.m. yesterday at Pennsylvania Avenue near the Belt Parkway. In the other accident, a 27-year-old man was killed and his passenger, also a man in his 20s, suffered head and neck injuries when the motorcycle they were riding collided with a 1999 Ford Taurus at 10 p.m. Saturday at Rockaway Parkway and Church Avenue in Brownsville. The injured man was listed in stable condition at Brookdale University Hospital and Medical Center, the police said. No charges were expected.

Two men died and a third man was seriously injured in two motor vehicle accidents Saturday night and early yesterday, the police said. A 58-year-old man was killed when he drove a Mercedes-Benz through a fence and into a parked car at 3:45 a.m. yesterday at Pennsylvania Avenue near the Belt Parkway. In the other accident, a 27-year-old man was killed and his passenger, also a man in his 20s, suffered head and neck injuries when the motorcycle they were riding collided with a 1999 Ford Taurus at 10 p.m. Saturday at Rockaway Parkway and Church Avenue in Brownsville. The injured man was listed in stable condition at Brookdale University Hospital and Medical Center, the police said. No charges were expected.
